alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 13 at 4:06PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northern Connecticut, including the following areas, Hartford CT and Tolland CT. Portions of western Massachusetts, including the following areas, Eastern Franklin MA, Eastern Hampden MA, Eastern Hampshire MA, Western Franklin MA, Western Hampden MA and Western Hampshire MA. * WHEN...Through early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas, potentially impacting the Friday morning commute. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Ground and soil conditions are saturated across the Watch area. Thunderstorms are expected to move in late this afternoon into tonight into the Watch area. Additional rounds of heavy showers and thunderstorms are possible later tonight and into the overnight hours. This may worsen or trigger new areas of flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
